website_summaries.verdict: Buyers looking for an inexpensive, reusable rain poncho will find their match in this colorful piece.
pros: Offered in many various styles and colors
Includes a case for easy transport and storage
Drawstrings on hood for simple cinch
cons: Color not true to online pictures
Material is thinner than some buyers would have liked

customer_reviews.title: Very Spacious. Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this poncho for a trip to Disney World. It is absolutely enormous both width and length wise (I'm 5'7") and I'm so grateful. I was able to wear my backpack under the poncho comfortably. I looked ridiculous but it kept everything dry under downpours (see photo below). Besides, is anyone really wearing a bright red rain poncho because they are trying to be super cute???? Running down the sides, under both arms are snaps. These snaps can be fastened to create arm holes or unsnapped. I'd say that its pretty durable for multiple uses. The reusable mesh baggie it comes packaged inside is great for keeping things organized.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: beware picture of red color is wrong and it will not have cords in hood
customer_reviews.text: I selected the color red because that was the only color that showed the cords on the hood which I needed - well I could have taken any other color because the picture is wrong and you get the same as the other colors with no cord in the hood :( Below the picture from the listing that clearly shows the cords but the item you receive will NOT have a cord in the hood. @seller please replace the picture it is missleading
customer_reviews.author: Liliane Grimm

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: This product is NOT what is pictured. It does NOT have the drawstrings on the hood or the snaps down the middle of the neck as pictured. It does have the snaps on the side. But the reason I decided to buy this one was because of the drawstring on the hood. Unhappy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: I finally tried this thing out for the first time last night. I opened it up and my heart sank; a solid poke with a fingernail would be able to rip the "fabric". Not having much of a choice, I left in it anyway... and THE WIND was able to unsnap it. At one point I was a drenched mass, with a cheap blue tornado attached at my neck, obscuring my vision.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn McMurray

customer_reviews.title: Good ponchos, good price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of ponchos for a recent trip. They are easy to fold and put back into the mesh pouches that come with them and perform their function well. They have a very loose cut, so they will work for both smaller and larger people (I am usually a 2x and I had plenty of room to spare).
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Significantly better than a normal poncho; worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a trip to South America and got rained on... a lot. This held up really well and kept me impressively untouched by the rain. It also packs up well, it's heavy, and comes with a mesh carrier bag that works nicely. I was hesitant to spend money on a poncho when you can get them so cheaply in so many places, but after this experience I can confidently say it's worth the little bit of extra cost to get a really well made product. This thing is coming with me on all my outdoorsy trips from here on out :)
customer_reviews.author: Joe M Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and very wide
customer_reviews.text: I find umbrellas to be useless. There’s almost always wind with rain so you get wet with sideways rain and the umbrella breaks. It’s also exhausting to control an umbrella in the wind. So now I wear a poncho and this one on particular is really good. It sits halfway down my thigh and is very wide. I carry my laptop underneath and arrive to work or leisure dry.
customer_reviews.author: OfflineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: This garment is made of very thin plastic material which is good from the point of view of lightness and packaging but may be bad for it's longevity. Bought 2 of these for attending a outdoors sporting event and they worked well. 2 hours of fairly hard rain and neither myself or friend got wet at all. For the price I would say excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: LordPanic

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste $8.50. Super flimsy thin.
customer_reviews.text: I will be surprised if it survives one use. It is made of super thin plastic like the disposable ones, except instead of a dollar it cost $8.50. The pouch is better made than the poncho. "Totes" used to be a good brand but now its just junk. The plastic bag it came in was more sturdy than the product!
customer_reviews.author: 12° RN

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE YOU BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT WHAT I ORDERED THE PRODUCT IS NOT THE SAME AS THE PICTURED PRODUCT!!! The poncho does NOT have drawstrings or snaps at the neck!!
customer_reviews.author: Carla M. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Costa Rica Parka! Pura Vida!
customer_reviews.text: I called Amazon due to the color which I thought was going to be an Army Green, but it’s a pretty blue-ish green, which I don’t really prefer. The representative not only gave me a refund but they also allowed me to keep the Tote! Here in Costa Rica it did keep me dry during our hikes but when the sun shines I had to emerge due to the heat! It is a very substantial product. Great customer service too!
customer_reviews.author: Simpatico

customer_reviews.title: the red ones: no draw string, nor snaps on the neck opening
customer_reviews.text: Well, although I think the product is of fine quality, I am irritated. I ordered the red ones because the photo with the model shows that the red one has draw string on the hood and opening on the neck with snaps, but the ones I received do not. They are just like all the other ones, no draw string and no snaps. If I have known this, I would have ordered the yellow ones. But, it is not worth the trouble to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Smoreo

customer_reviews.title: Durable and convenient zippered carrying pouch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for a trip to Costa Rica for my husband and son. They said that they worked great, as they were travelling during the rainy season. They fit both of them fine and they are about 6 ft tall, and weigh around 165 pounds each. We purchased the poncho in a gray and were happy with it. It also came in a nice little zippered pouch which made packing it into their backpacks very convenient. I would recommend and purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: LighthouseLyn

customer_reviews.title: It's a poncho
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was expecting, but this is massive. It could be because I'm short, but when I put it on at my office, one of my coworkers stood up at the office and said "what are you going to Niagara Falls?" It's really big, but I needed something to protect me from the rain as I'm 8 months pregnant and normal rain jackets don't work. I'm also 4'11' so it's really, really long on me, but at least I'm dry!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: Small fit, not for full sized adults.
customer_reviews.text: The hood was very tight and hard to pull on and off with ease. After about the 10th time, the parka ripped and was no longer functional as the hood would not stay up in the wind. This would work for a small adult or child, otherwise the fit is too short at the arms and legs. I ended up with soaked lower pants, shoes and lower arms before the hood ripped and my head and chest also got wet.
customer_reviews.author: Whalers

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended Ponchos
customer_reviews.text: We were nicely surprised to see the quality of the ponchos. They are large enough to wear a sweater or sweat shirt underneath and long enough to help stay dry above the knees. We purchased these for a trip/cruise to Alaska where we expect chilly and possibly rainy weather. These will be perfect. They fold back up easily to return to the little storage bag they come in. They are light weight so wont take up much room or precious luggage weight (for the airline baggage fees.) We highly recommend these to other travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Massive! Enormous!
customer_reviews.text: This was huge!!! You can definitely fit a plus size or larger pregnant person in here with room to spare! I'm about a 22 now that I had my son (gained over 70 lbs) and I was swimming in this! I would definitely think that this would be far too big for someone that's considered thin.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Really Big - enough to cover me and scooter!
customer_reviews.text: Used this at Walt Disney World during a torrential rainstorm and I was so happy I packed it! So much better than the cheap stuff others sell. This is definitely oversize - covered me and the scooter and all our stuff tucked in and kept dry. Definitely recommend!! I am sure this would cover a big guy up to 6 ft 6 in too, definitely roomy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every peny
customer_reviews.text: I bought 11 of these in various sizes and colors for a trip to Disney. We used them the first day. Better quality than any of the others and the price was equal or better. They actually can fold up to be back in the pouch for next time
customer_reviews.author: Rosezk

customer_reviews.title: Very meh
customer_reviews.text: Bag broke apart trying to put it away the first time and tore a small hole in the poncho. So I feel like I should’ve just bought one for a dollar at Walmart. Hood extended out way to much and created tunnel vision, kept having to swivel head.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Rainslyland I am DISNEYLAND
customer_reviews.text: I am 5’0 . It comes down to my shins. It’s right to my hands. I figured this would be a little big on me but I am small. We got these for the whole entire family for our trip for Disneyland.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Good value, useful
customer_reviews.text: I think this raincoat/poncho will be just fine (haven't worn it yet--we in Berkeley, California are still waiting for the big rains that are promised). It is very roomy, but that is good; it will fit over whatever I am wearing. And no matter how I wrap it up, it will fit back into the little pouch that comes with it. It was very reasonably priced. So I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cs consumer

customer_reviews.title: Beware the Dye
customer_reviews.text: The poncho works fine and I had zero complaints until it dyed my $70 creme colored Mercy sweater blue. It dyed the thing blue. It wasnt even wet I had it in my bag that day I just brought it just in case it rained that day to six flags and it dyed my sweater blue. I'm more then a bit mad about that.
customer_reviews.author: MissCin101

customer_reviews.title: Its ok,but not really quality
customer_reviews.text: arrived quickly, great fit. cheap construction however. when i tried to unbutton two of the sleeve buttons, one ripped completely off and the other caused a rip in the jacket, I can still wear it but that happened on the first use and was extremely disappointing.

customer_reviews.author: FlanNH

customer_reviews.title: This comes in a mesh draw string bag just like the kids version of this poncho

When I am not camping I plan on keeping this in the car for freak rain showers that seem to always happen in the Midwest.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to put on and take off

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I needed them for but it depends on your plans
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our cruise to Alaska. We had good luck with the weather and only needed them once. However, they did the job. The material was thinner than I hoped but I think that honestly goes hand-in-hand with the price. I bought these because I wanted a 'just in case' rain poncho and I didn't really care if I had to throw it away after a couple of uses. Overall, this is a good buy if you're getting it to use a couple of times and aren't worried about keeping them long-term.
customer_reviews.author: Sunndays in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: a waterproof poncho
customer_reviews.text: The tote is absolutely perfect...with one exception! I wish that the neck opening was a bit larger. Neither my husband nor I have large heads, but getting heads through that small opening is a bit difficult.Our main concern,however, was that it be completely waterproof and that it cover all of a person, which it most certainly does.
customer_reviews.author: Lindi Kendal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outings scheduled on days that threaten rain.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my day trip pack. I like to always be prepared, and if we have an outing, and the threat of rain, these are perfect for my day pack. Heavy enough to not rip, and light enough to carry easily. Easier than most umbrellas. Got to the car, nice and dry underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne M Cassick

customer_reviews.title: looks nice
customer_reviews.text: this product looks like good quality. i got two and each came in a nice little pouch (a little hard to fit them back into the pouch after it is unfolded), the Poncho is more durable than i expected and i hope it will us well in our week long hiking vacation in the Hawaiian rain forest. also the poncho was larger than i expected which is good in a way because it covers more, not too large though, my hands were still exposed.
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: The material feels nice, not too thin

The color is exactly as in the picture, this ruby shade of red. The material feels nice, not too thin. Several buttons on the sides. I don't recommend it for hot weather rains (because of condensation) unless its to wear for short periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Mont

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight option

This will fit most anyone. I usually wear a L or XL in a women's jacket and this is very roomy. The case and poncho folded up fits in my regular purse and weighs almost nothing.

customer_reviews.title: It was so wide I couldn't even walk or maneuver comfortably. The neck was so small/tight

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my daughter, but my husband said he'd use it too.

customer_reviews.title: Light reusable ponchos

customer_reviews.title: full coverage

customer_reviews.text: Works great. It’s quiet big, which is nice because there is lots of room to move and you can put your backpack under it. A bit long for someone who is shorter. Hood stays on really well without fear of it slipping off.

customer_reviews.title: I love it as much as you can love a plastic ...

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!

customer_reviews.title: Did the Trick for Keeping me dry during a parade
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't wear this as a fashion statement, but if you definitely want to be water-protected for a parade or sporting event, this is the inexpensive way to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If your child has a wingspan of at least 66 inches, then this is the pancho to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: good enough to keep me dry
customer_reviews.text: Will keep me dry in an emergency, and is sturdier than the cheap one. It slips over my head easily and the snaps under the arms are great to keep it from blowing around. It's plenty long, and as to the comments about the hood blowing off - it's snug enough that I'm not concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Coverage
customer_reviews.text: Easly torn. Long enough for full coverage. Need drawstring head gear

customer_reviews.title: It kept us dry during our trip to Peru but ...
customer_reviews.text: It kept us dry during our trip to Peru but it was so gigantic that we hesitate taking it places and have not used it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect nice and roomy etiquette me dry. Fold away perfectly in my backpack. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Williams

customer_reviews.title: I like that there are snaps on the arm holes and ...
customer_reviews.text: The material is somewhat thinner than I expected but I suppose that is necessary if it is going to fit in the pouch. I like that there are snaps on the arm holes and that it is easily carried in a purse or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huizar

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: It has buttons on the sides to keep the rain and wind from getting in, too. It works great for walking my large dog in the rain. I still have free arm movement, and I stay dry even with my arms stretched out with the leash and the dog. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Cruze

customer_reviews.title: no clue
customer_reviews.text: This gift again does not ring a bell to me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ferrero

customer_reviews.title: Me and my backpack stay dry
customer_reviews.text: I am glad for the storage pouch that comes with the item. It protects it and makes it easy to travel with or have handy in the car. I haven't used the item in the rain because I bought it in preparation for a future trip. However, I have had similar rain ponchos before and they were excellent especially to wear over a backpack so that both me and my stuff stays dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kiran Lakshman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a back up raincoat. Our weather is so unpredictable when it comes to rain and I work outdoors. It does the job of keeping me dry. However, it is a bit large. If it is windy, be prepared to have to hold it closely to stay dry. Easy to dry and refold.
customer_reviews.author: madonna

customer_reviews.title: Fit was right and would have done a great job, if we had experienced rain
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as expected. Fit was right and would have done a great job, if we had experienced rain.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Ausloos

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: A little small in the neck area for some folks who may not like collars (includes me) but otherwise a great fit and good quality for the price. I would buy them again if/when needed.
customer_reviews.author: TClark

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver in a torrential downpour with no shelter!
customer_reviews.text: Used these at an all-day outdoor concert. They also came in handy to sit on when the rain stopped. They are durable and thick enough to do the job without trapping all my body heat inside.
customer_reviews.author: LPJax

product_meta.description: Classic protection plus durability! the by Totes unisex rain poncho boasts total coverage for those outside events and activities. Side snaps make throwing on this poncho a breeze. Game day looking grey no problem. Just toss this poncho in your car for portable rainy day protection-the convenient storage pouch makes it easy. Care instructions: wipe clean with damp cloth. Do not machine wash. Do not iron. Do not dry clean.
